revision.text:
{{Infobox spaceflight | name = Kosmos 2465 | mission_type = [[Satellite navigation|Navigation]] | operator = [[Russian Space Forces]] | COSPAR_ID = 2010-041B<ref name="zarya"/> | SATCAT = 37138<ref name="zarya"/> | mission_duration =
| spacecraft = GC 737 | spacecraft_type = [[Uragan-M]] | manufacturer = [[JSC Information Satellite Systems|Reshetnev ISS]] <ref name="tsenki"/> | launch_mass = {{convert|1415|kg}} <ref name="tsenki"/> | dimensions = {{convert|1.3|m}} diameter <ref name="tsenki"/> | power = 1,540 watts<ref name="tsenki"/>
| launch_date = {{start-date|September 2, 2010, 04:26|timezone=yes}} UTC | launch_rocket = [[Proton-M]]/[[Blok DM-2|DM-2]]<ref name="tsenki"/> | launch_site = [[Baikonur Cosmodrome|Baikonur]] [[Baikonur Cosmodrome Site 81|81/24]] | entered_service =
| disposal_type = | deactivated =
| orbit_epoch = | orbit_reference = [[Geocentric orbit|Geocentric]] | orbit_regime = [[Medium Earth orbit]]<ref name="McDowell"/> | orbit_semimajor = {{convert|25505|km}}<ref name="zarya"/> | orbit_eccentricity = 0.0003<ref name="zarya"/> | orbit_periapsis = {{convert|19119|km}}<ref name="zarya"/> | orbit_apoapsis = {{convert|19135|km}}<ref name="zarya"/> | orbit_inclination = 64.83 degrees<ref name="zarya"/> | orbit_period = 675.60 minutes<ref name="zarya"/> | orbit_slot = | apsis = gee }} '''Kosmos 2465''' ({{lang-ru|''Космос 2465''}} meaning ''Cosmos 2465'') is one of a set of three [[Russia]]n military [[satellite]]s launched in 2010 as part of the [[GLONASS]] satellite navigation system. It was launched with [[Kosmos 2464]] and [[Kosmos 2466]].
This satellite is a GLONASS-M satellite, also known as Uragan-M, and is numbered Uragan-M No. 737.<ref name="zarya"/><ref name="LaunchLog"/>
Kosmos 2464/5/6 were launched from [[Baikonur Cosmodrome Site 81|Site 81/24]] at [[Baikonur Cosmodrome]] in Kazakhstan. A [[Proton-M]] carrier rocket with a [[Blok D|Blok DM]] upper stage was used to perform the launch which took place at 05:49 UTC on 2 September 2010. The launch successfully placed the satellites into [[Medium Earth orbit]]. It subsequently received its [[Kosmos (satellite)|Kosmos]] designation, and the [[international designator]] 2010-041B. The [[United States Space Command]] assigned it the [[Satellite Catalog Number]] 27138.<ref name="zarya"/><ref name="LaunchLog"/>
It is in the second orbital plane of the GLONASS constellation, in orbital slot 12. It started operations on 4 October 2010.<ref name="podvig2"/><ref name="GLONASS"/>
==See also== *[[List of Kosmos satellites (2251–2500)]] *[[List of Proton launches (2010–2019)]]

<ref name="tsenki">{{cite web|url=http://www.tsenki.com/en/launch_services/help_information/launch/2010/?EID=92124#tab-Payloads-link|title=Glonass-M spacecrafts launch (Kosmos-2464, -2465, -2466)|publisher=TsENKI|date=n.d.|accessdate=2012-10-07}}</ref> <ref name="McDowell">{{cite web|url=http://planet4589.org/space/log/satcat.txt|title=Satellite Catalog|first=Jonathan|last=McDowell|work=Jonathan's Space Page|accessdate=30 April 2012}}</ref> <ref name="LaunchLog">{{cite web|url=http://planet4589.org/space/log/launchlog.txt|title=Launch Log|first=Jonathan|last=McDowell|work=Jonathan's Space Page|accessdate=2 May 2012}}</ref> <ref name="podvig2">{{cite web|url=http://russianforces.org/space/navigation/glonass.shtml|title=Glonass|publisher=Russian Forces|date=2013-05-01|accessdate=2013-05-03}}</ref> <ref name="GLONASS">{{cite web|url=http://www.glonass-ianc.rsa.ru/en/GLONASS/|title=GLONASS constellation status, 03.05.2013|publisher=Information-analytical centre, Korolyov, Russia|date=2013-05-03|accessdate=2013-05-03}}</ref> </references> {{Orbital launches in 2010}} {{GLONASS}}
